item.title: APU Fire Extinguisher System – APU Auto Discharge Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the APU controls at the wheel well or flight deck are monitored by a qualified operator at all times when the APU is used during ground operations.

note.para: Ensure APU, if operating, is not left unattended.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU fire switch and warning light on the pilots overhead panel: "APU BTL A (or B) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: APU Fire Extinguisher System – APU Auto Discharge

numlitem.para: If APU is to be used during ground operations:
For APU controls monitored from Flight Deck:

When the aircraft is on the ground and a fire is detected in the APU compartment, the APU fire switch handle (M7326) red warning light illuminates. The fire extinguishing agent is discharged in APU compartment when APU fire switch handle is pulled and rotated in either direction.
For APU controls monitored from Wheel Well:

When the aircraft is on the ground and fire is detected in APU compartment, the red APU FIRE light on M869 APU shutdown module illuminates. The fire extinguishing agent is discharged in APU compartment by pulling the APU FIRE CONTROL handle and pushing the APU EXTINGUISHER DISCHARGE switch located in the right main wheel well.
